4920/A0/05/080/001.headline: Advocacy and response efforts have been supported with reliable data  strong messages and moving stories. UNICEF has been able to ensure the continuity of its humanitarian programming across the country despite numerous challenges and will continue to fundraise in view of the increasing needs in Yemen

4920/A0/05/060/001.status_value: No update. However 340 Govt. staff were trained.

4920/A0/05/060/001.headline: UNICEF effectively responded to the serious outbreaks of dengue  cholera/awd  and scabies with the help of Community Volunteers  leaders and religious leaders.

4920/A0/05/010/002.headline: Focus remained on preventing excess maternal  Newborn and child morbidity and mortality in the most affected areas/ governorates of the country. 4920/A0/05/010/003.indicator_name: Multisectoral Nutrition Coordination Body is functional with plan and budget at both national and sub-national levels
4920/A0/05/010/003.headline: The national SUN secretariat was supported to attend global events physically and remotely and continues reporting to the Global Sun Secretariat at Geneva including the reporting for 2015 review. A Nutrition Strategic Planning Workshop on current strategy conducted in April recommended re-defining `scaling-up' CMAM and reaching the unreached GAM cases.

4920/A0/05/010/003.indicator_name: Number of governorates with institutional capacity for bottleneck analysis and planning of high impact interventions at sub-national and community levels
4920/A0/05/010/003.headline: The national SUN secretariat was supported to attend global events physically and remotely and continues reporting to the Global Sun Secretariat at Geneva including the reporting for 2015 review. A Nutrition Strategic Planning Workshop on current strategy conducted in April recommended re-defining `scaling-up' CMAM and reaching the unreached GAM cases.

4920/A0/05/010/004.status_value: 0. UNICEF got the clearance and provided RUTF to the OTPs that were suffering from the stock out (for 2-3 weeks in November) in three governorates due to challenges in provision of clearance to bring RUTF to the north side of the country.
4920/A0/05/010/004.indicator_name: Number of stock outs of 10 lifesaving commodities in emergencies
4920/A0/05/010/004.headline: As a response to the emergency and humanitarian situation in Yemen  UNICEF Yemen took the whole responsibility and provided the country with all supplies needed for the management of severe acute malnutrition with transportation services to assure delivering the supplies to service delivery outlets.

4920/A0/05/010/005.status_value: An MNCH study with some analysis on equity and gender aspects done. Not comprehensive.
4920/A0/05/010/005.indicator_name: Equity and gender analysis completed on utilization of maternal  child health and nutrition services
4920/A0/05/010/005.headline: Due to on-going conflict  work has not progressed on this output in 2016.

4920/A0/05/010/005.indicator_name: Percentage of the trained CHVs and trained health workers are women and from marginalised communities (muhamasheen)
4920/A0/05/010/005.headline: Due to on-going conflict  work has not progressed on this output in 2016.

4920/A0/05/002/008.status_value: 4 rounds of sampling concluded  Social protection Survey. EHA and Review of Early recovery in the North is constrained due to security issues. SMART survey training conducted for Humanitarian Actors in three additional Governorates. Rapid assessment Child protection rapid assessment training undertaken in North and South.

4920/A0/05/070/002.status_value: almost 80% of the planned IPs were Micro-assessed

4920/A0/05/070/002.headline: Within the HACT assurance plan  the programmatic field visits are making good progress while Audit and Spot-checks are yet to pick up the pace. The Section continues reporting in the monthly Programme Coordination Meeting on the status of programme implementations.

4920/A0/05/070/002.status_value: Programatic visits by both staff and TPM. Potential exists for improvement in follow-up of recommendations.

4920/A0/05/002/003.status_value: 6 -Sex and geographically disaggregated data is available for the 6 grave violations that are being monitoring/reported and documented to the MRM database. While the JJ IMS exists  the roll out is partial in which reports are not being generated yet.
4920/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: Number of harmonized child protection inidicators for which sex & geographically disaggregated data is available for all age groups through established Child Protection information management system

4920/A0/05/002/003.status_value: 0- Through the Juvenile Justice Information System and MRM database  child protection indiciators related to children in contact with the law and grave child rights violations are harmonized for which sex and geographically disaggregated data is available for all age groups.
4920/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: Percentage harmonized child protection indicators for which sex & geographically disaggregated data is available for all age groups through established Child Protection Information Management System

4920/A0/05/002/003.status_value: 2 functional sub-systems in place (MRM CAAC data base and Child Justice MIS)  Through MRM CAAC database -By end Nov 2013: at least 99 children were killed (13 boys  3 girls) or maimed (70 boys  13 girls)  42 boys recruited  1 child victim of rape or other grave sexual violence  1 boy abducted  13 attacks on schools (11) and hospitals (2)  10 attacks on denial of humanitarian access reported and verified through the MRM Database  MRM Database is functional generating reports contributing to 3 GHN
4920/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: Number of functional sub-systems in place (Electronic birth registration (BR) system  MRM CAAC data base  Child Justice (CJ) MIS)

4920/A0/05/070/001.status_value: All RWPS finalized on time. However not signed due to the conflict.
4920/A0/05/070/001.indicator_name: Number of Government workplans that have been signed before end of January
4920/A0/05/070/001.headline: PME ensured the office to finalise the 2016-2017 RWPs with provision of technical support and guidance. The new RWPs were designed incorporating the new Yemen Humanitarian Response Plan (YHRP) 2016 in addition to the priorities set out in the MTR revised Country Programme Action Plan (CPAP).

4920/A0/05/070/001.status_value: A project on Conflict sensitive Planning is being implemented
4920/A0/05/070/001.indicator_name: Number of Governorate level workshops on RBM conducted with participation from Line Ministries' DGs (MoPIC  MoHealth  MoWater  MoE  MoLSA)
4920/A0/05/070/001.headline: PME ensured the office to finalise the 2016-2017 RWPs with provision of technical support and guidance. The new RWPs were designed incorporating the new Yemen Humanitarian Response Plan (YHRP) 2016 in addition to the priorities set out in the MTR revised Country Programme Action Plan (CPAP).

4920/A0/05/002/004.status_value: Yes (Target): The Social Protection Monitoring (SPM) survey was officially launched on the 29th of September  which aims to serve as routine social protection monitoring system at national level
4920/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: A routine social protection monitoring system is in place at national level

4920/A0/05/002/004.status_value: 0% (Target): The SPM baseline and follow-up data collection  will also aim to evaluate the impact of cash transfer programme in Yemen  which is the main social protection mechanism
4920/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: Percentage of planned evaluations of social protection interventions completed

4920/A0/05/002/004.status_value: 0% (Target): The result of the impact evaluation of the cash transfer programme  which is one of the main expected outcomes of the SPM survey  will be available at the end of Q1 2014  after completion of the anaysis of the final data collection round  in Q4 2013
4920/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: Proportion of key evaluation recommendations implemented within identified timeline

4920/A0/05/070/004.status_value: Office Gender task force trained on GEM and PCAs reviewed for gender compliance
4920/A0/05/070/004.indicator_name: Number of UNICEF Sectors (by Outcome) effectively (base/end assessment) trained in gender mainstreaming  with sectoral assessment (GAP methodology) completed  and recommendations fully integrated into RWPs
4920/A0/05/070/004.headline: Since the escalation of the conflict  UNICEF has been persistent in advocating and mainstreaming of gender equality. Gender National team (Government staff) and Gender focal points (UNICEF staff) have been equipped with the knowledge and skills on using Gender Equity measurement tools

4920/A0/05/001/011.status_value: (No) UNICEF has supported SWF to conduct 10 training of trainers (TOT) and training workshops to equip 200 SWF staff from the beneficiary development departments in the targeted governorates. The aim is to ensure effective targeting at decentralized level for the poorest and most vulnerable households
4920/A0/05/001/011.indicator_name: SWF beneficiary targeting mechanism explicitly measures children's risks and vulnerability

4920/A0/05/001/011.status_value: 0% (Target): The SPM Q1 baseline report was launched in end of June  data collection on all four rounds completed by Q4 2013  and the results as per the evaluation will only be available in the first quarter of 2014
4920/A0/05/001/011.indicator_name: Proportion of poor and vulnerable households identified via the social protection monitoring system are enrolled in SWF protection schemes

4920/A0/05/001/010.status_value: Drafting committee finalized the final drafts for 15 legislations  including a unified child rights law. Draft plan is already submitted for advocacy for ratification by Parliament.  The HCMC has agreed to  the proposed amendments and refered them to  MOSAL. If agreed   they will be sent to the Prime Minister office for approval before refering them to the parliament.
4920/A0/05/001/010.indicator_name: Number of key pieces of legislation related to children (child rights law  penal code  juvenile justice law and personal status law)  reviewed  amended and endorsed by Government and ratified by Parliament

4920/A0/05/001/010.status_value: None as yet. However  an analysis of the policies and procedures followed by Juvenile Courts and Prosecutors has been conducted  gaps were identified and recommendations for improving the performance have been made  best practices and minimum standards for gender sensitive and child friendly justice system at the police  prosecution and courts level have been identified. Consultation process has been started to get the feedback of all stakeholders on this exercise. a report will be produced by e
4920/A0/05/001/010.indicator_name: Number of policies for incorporating child justice standards developed

4920/A0/05/001/010.status_value: There are no data available yet for this indicator. However  a capacity assessment for the work of MOJ on justice for children has been conducted and TOR with a proposed structure for the Justice for Children Department developed. A capacity assessment for the work of MOJ on justice for children has been conducted and TOR with a proposed structure for the Justice for Children Department developed. A customized inspection training tool for detention and care facilities that deals with children ha
4920/A0/05/001/010.indicator_name: Percentage of girls and boys in contact with the law as victims  offenders or witnesses that use child friendly and gender sensitive justice services.

4920/A0/05/001/010.status_value: No Data available. This indicator will be deactivated. Social monitoring and non-custodial measures program started implementation in Aden  Hodeidha  Ibb and Taiz. Next quarter it will be expanded in Sana'a. A draft study on restorative justice in Yemen has been finalised. it will be circulated for feedback before been printed.
4920/A0/05/001/010.indicator_name: Percentage of children in contact with the law that benefitted from diversion  alternatives to deprivation of liberty and restorative

4920/A0/05/080/004.indicator_name: Percentage of donor reports submitted on time
4920/A0/05/080/004.headline: During the first semester of the year UNICEF has reached 70% of its funding needs for humanitarian action. Stronger relationships with partners and donors are built on quality reporting and visibility. Further resource mobilisation will be made during the 2nd semester to ensure funds available for 2017 activities

4920/A0/05/050/001.indicator_name: Number of valnerable people provided with Humanitarain cash transfers
4920/A0/05/050/001.headline: The poorest and most excluded Muhamasheen communities as well as conflict-affected population were reached with HCT in two governorates to improve their food security  enable them to meet basic needs and access social services  and hence reduce their social and economic vulnerabilities. A monitoring and grievance mechanisms were also set-up

4920/A0/05/050/002.indicator_name: Data is available on effectiveness of the Social Protection Systems  disaggregated by sex and age of beneficiaries and institutionalized in SWF MIS systems in three locations (central level and in two governorates)
4920/A0/05/050/002.headline: Some progress was achieved in identification of technical assistance to help ensure regular  efficient and transparent resumption of SWF unconditional cash transfers to the poorest and most disadvantaged beneficiaries. Multi-party advocacy and fundraising efforts to support reactivation of the SWF are ongoing

4920/A0/05/050/003.indicator_name: Technical review is completed at national and subnational level to address  identified budgeting barriers and bottlenecks for the most disadvantaged children
4920/A0/05/050/003.headline: With ongoing political rivalry and violent conflict  progress on public finance for children is partially constrained. The Ministry of Planning and International Cooperation (MoPIC) however continues publishing a monthly Yemen Social and Economic Update (YSEU) covering public finance and social policy issues impacting children and their families
